meanings.definition: The state or quality of being luminous or shining.
meanings.sent1: The lucences of the stars filled the night sky with brightness.
meanings.sent2: The lucences of the fireflies lit up the garden at night.
meanings.sent3: The room was so dark that even a tiny lucences from a flashlight seemed like a spotlight.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a natural lucences that brightened up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The lucences of the full moon reflected on the calm lake, creating a magical scene.

meanings.sent1: The lucences of the lighthouse guided ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent2: The lucences of the lantern flickered in the dark cave.
meanings.sent3: The lucences of the disco ball made the dance floor sparkle with light.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a warm lucences that made him feel at ease.
meanings.sent5: The lucences of the fireworks painted the night sky with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: The quality of being clear or transparent.
meanings.sent1: The lucences of the crystal made it look like pure ice.
meanings.sent2: The lucences of the glass allowed him to see through to the other side.
meanings.sent3: The lucences of the water droplets on the window created a blurry view outside.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation had a lucences that made everything easy to understand.
meanings.sent5: The lucences of the diamond sparkled in the sunlight, dazzling everyone around.
